instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG? This is battery power that flows to the system AFTER it has gone through a current sense resistor, before it goes through a fuse to become PPBUS_G3H power rail. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 5v
threads.message:
Hello, I have this mac that was working, but stopped turning on unexpectedly. There was no contact with liquid.
It replaces the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40. 
<CAPACITOR>C7030</CAPACITOR>, <RESISTOR>R7030</RESISTOR>/40 are okay.

Voltage:
I removed F7000/01, in the <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG</SIGNAL> mesh there is 12.33V.

In diode mode on the PPbus 0.275v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 5v
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with F7000/1 soldered in place?
What about <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>?
Did you test with 96/140W charger?
Also try with battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 5v
threads.message:
Without the F7000/1 fuse, it's 12.3V.
With the fuse it's 4.8V.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_X</SIGNAL> 28mV | diode mode 0.390v

I'm using the original 96W charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 5v
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> should give you higher value in diode mode to ground.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL]
Check it in reverse way too (black on ground).
Then check if any big coil gives you the same readings.
Don't forget the small coils for SSD (L9080/580).
